casebody.data:
Kenneth R. HART, Appellant,
v.
STATE of Missouri, Respondent. ED 105952 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION FOUR. Filed: November 20, 2018 Gwenda R. Robinson, 1010 Market Street, Suite 1100, St. Louis, MO 63101, for appellant. Joshua D. Hawley, Evan J. Buchheim, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102, for respondent. Before: Kurt S. Odenwald, P.J., Gary M. Gaertner, Jr., J., and Colleen Dolan, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Kenneth R. Hart (Movant) appeals the judgment of the motion court denying his motion for post-conviction relief under Missouri Rule of Civil Procedure 29.15 after an evidentiary hearing. We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal, and we conclude the motion court's decision was not clearly erroneous. An extended opinion would have no precedential value. The parties have been provided with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order. The decision is affirmed. Mo. R. Civ. P. 84.16(b).
